title: Forgotten Hero
opening: Something is attacking people in the forests of Margrave Edmund's territory, and a Crest scholar blames Marianne.

intro.line: There’s no reason to feign ignorance. I know all about you!

intro.speaker: Marianne
intro.line: Wh-what are you talking about?
Just come here!

intro.speaker: Marianne
intro.line: Professor! Help!
Don’t interfere. Just hand the girl over to me.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Never.
I’m telling you this for your own good. You’re putting yourself in danger by associating with her.

Do you know of the Wandering Beast stalking in the wood in the Edmund territory? It is said that it attacks people every night and drags them off to feast. The true identity of the Wandering Beast... Is that girl right there!

intro.speaker: Marianne
intro.line: No! I would never...

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Get out of here!
No matter. I’ll get the evidence I need...

intro.speaker: Marianne
intro.line: My apologies for you getting involved in that...

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: What happened?

intro.speaker: Marianne
intro.line: In truth, that man has been following me ever since my father disappeared... He’s a Crest scholar.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Why is he following you?

intro.speaker: Marianne
intro.line: The Crest that my father bore and was passed down to me... It was... Maurice’s Crest.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Maurice’s Crest?

intro.speaker: Marianne
intro.line: Yes. It’s also known as...the Crest of the Beast... It’s said there were once 12 heroes who saved Fódlan. There was the King of Liberation, Nemesis...the 10 Elites, and finally...Maurice. One day, Maurice suddenly transformed into a hideous beast and slaughtered innocent people. It was like when Miklan of House Gautier turned into a Black Beast. The negative energy dwelling within his Crest turned Maurice into a monster. The people of Fódlan grew to despise him, and he was stripped of his honor. His whole clan was conquered, and it was believed that his bloodline had vanished... But even now, there exist a few descendants who have inherited Maurice’s Crest, and his curse. My family line...is one of them. Maurice’s Crest is a symbol of disaster. Anyone who comes in contact with it is met with great misfortune. Those who carry the Crest became beasts at night and slaughter innocent people.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: What that man mentioned earlier...

intro.speaker: Marianne
intro.line: Yes, the rumor about the Wandering Beast in the woods... People are saying the creature is similar in appearance to Maurice’s bestial form.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: If it’s defeated, wouldn’t the rumor be dispelled?

intro.speaker: Marianne
intro.line: That may be true but...I doubt I could do it on my own. If you and some of the other students came with me though...

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Let's go.

intro.speaker: Marianne
intro.line: Thank you! But, um... Promise you won't tell anyone about my Crest?

intro.speaker: Marianne
intro.line: I'm sorry to have to ask...but thank you!

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I'll think about it.

intro.speaker: Marianne
intro.line: It is my personal matter, so I can't expect you to get involved. But if you change your mind...I'll be waiting.

battle.speaker: Wandering Beast
battle.line: My beastly blood is roused... You will not be able to stop me!

character-falls.speaker: Marianne
character-falls.line: Dear Goddess... My soul is yours to take...

boss.speaker: Wandering Beast
boss.line: Nothing will stop me...from feasting upon your flesh and blood!

boss.speaker: Wandering Beast
boss.line: That sword... It's the sword of the king! Are you the one who can liberate me?!

boss.speaker: Wandering Beast
boss.line: Nothing will stop me...from feasting upon your flesh and blood!

boss.speaker: Claude
boss.line: That looks just like Miklan's Black Beast... Could a Hero's Relic be at fault?

boss.speaker: Wandering Beast
boss.line: Hero... That is a word that takes me back.

boss.speaker: Claude
boss.line: Takes you back? You... Are you...

boss.speaker: Wandering Beast
boss.line: After so long, I cannot speak of it.

end.speaker: Wandering Beast
end.line: Well done... Finally, this nightmare of a thousand years is at its end. Oh, inheritor of my Crest...if this body is to decay, then the sword... I leave it to you...

end.speaker: Marianne
end.line: I still can’t believe what we saw in that forest... The Wandering Beast’s eviscerated body... Only human bones and this sword remaining.

end.speaker: Marianne
end.line: Surely the creature’s true identity was...

end.speaker: Crest Scholar
end.line: I heard rumor that the Wandering Beast was slain, but do you really believe that frees you of suspicion? Without proof that it was slain, the argument that you are not a beast does not stand. Furthermore, I... Huh? Oh! That sword!

end.speaker: Marianne
end.line: When the Wandering Beast was defeated, this sword...

end.speaker: Crest Scholar
end.line: It’s unmistakable! Carved into that sword’s Crest stone is Maurice’s Crest! But how would the lost Magic Blade end up with the Wandering Beast? According to what I know of Maurice’s story, he didn’t let go of the sword until the very end. That must mean... I see. So that’s what happened... My apologies, it seems I was mistaken. I must be going.

end.speaker: Marianne
end.line: He was roaming the dark woods for over a thousand years, suffering for his murderous past.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Someone who bears the Crest of the Beast.

end.speaker: Marianne
end.line: No, I’m sure that was Maurice himself. He was roaming the dark woods for over a thousand years, suffering for his murderous past.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Good thing you were able to put an end to it.

end.speaker: Marianne
end.line: It’s true... And because of that, I feel as though...my curse has been lifted. The blood of a beast no longer flows through me. I feel human for once.

end.speaker: Marianne
end.line: Thank you, Professor. I couldn’t have done it on my own. Without your help, I would never have found peace. I’ll do anything I can to repay my debt to you!
